member.name: F:kCura.EventHandler.UriImprinter.QUERYSTRING_FINGERPRINT_KEY
member.summary: Default Query String Fingerprint.

member.summary: Default Version String.

member.name: M:kCura.EventHandler.UriImprinter.ImprintUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Imprints a query value onto an URL; useful for fingerprinting client resource link URLs such as JS and CSS files.
member.param: String representation of a URL
The key to imprint into the scriptFileUri's query segment
The value to imprint into the scriptFileUri's query segment
member.returns: An imprinted URI string
member.remarks: This will overwrite any existing query values with the same key as the one specified in querystringFingerprintKey. This method also uses the System.Uri and System.UriBuilder classes to do a lot of the heavy lifting; it will simplify URLs that contain . and .. directives.

member.name: T:kCura.EventHandler.UriImprinter
member.summary: Imprints a query value onto a URL.

member.param: Integer value identifying a case database.
Boolean flag indicating whether schema name should be used or not.
member.returns: Returns a prepend string value for a given case database based on application ID and a Boolean flag indicating whether the schema name should be used.

member.name: M:kCura.EventHandler.DatabaseConnection.GetMasterPrependString
member.summary: Returns a prepend string value for a master database.

member.returns: Returns a prepend string value for a master database based on boolean flag indicating if schema name should be used.

member.name: M:kCura.EventHandler.DatabaseConnection.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns the number of rows affected.
member.param: SQL statement to be executed.
SQL parameters used in SQL statement.
Number of seconds after which a SQL query should time out. Default value: -1 meaning execution of a SQL statement should never expire.
member.returns: Returns an integer value indicating the number of rows affected

member.name: M:kCura.EventHandler.DatabaseConnection.ExecuteAsDataSet(System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns a dataset object.
member.param: SQL statement to be executed.
SQL parameters used in SQL statement.
Number of seconds after which a SQL query should time out. The default value (-1) indicates that the execution of a SQL statement should never expire.
member.returns: Returns a dataset object.

member.name: M:kCura.EventHandler.DatabaseConnection.ExecuteAsScalar(System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the query, and returns the first column of the first row in the result set returned by the query. Additional columns or rows are ignored.
member.param: SQL statement to be executed.
SQL parameters used in SQL statement.
Number of seconds after which a SQL query should time out. Default value: -1 meaning execution of a SQL statement should never expire.
member.returns: returns an Object type that contains the result of the sql operation

member.name: T:kCura.EventHandler.DatabaseConnection
member.summary: Creates database connection instances.

member.name: P:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.Name
member.summary: Gets a name of a mass operation handler.
member.returns: String value indicating a name of a mass operation handler.

member.name: P:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.Helper
member.summary: Gets and/or sets the Helper property of the mass operation handler which returns IMOHHelper object from Relativity.API.

member.name: P:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.LayoutMask
member.summary: Gets and/or sets a layout mask for a current mass operation handler.
member.returns: Returns Artifact object.
member.remarks: This is applicable only for assembly backed mass operation handlers. Custom page mass operation handlers do not require that property to be set.

member.name: P:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.BatchIDs
member.summary: Gets and/or sets a list of integer values indicating ids included in a current batch.

member.name: P:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.MassActionTableName
member.summary: Gets and/or sets a name of a temporary table where all ids will be stored for batching work of a particular mass operation handler.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.DoBatch
member.summary: Abstract method which will execute a batch.
member.returns: Returns a Response object.
member.remarks: This assumes PreMassOperation method executes successfully.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.PreMassOperation
member.summary: Abstract method which will be executed prior to DoBatch() method.)
member.returns: Returns a Response object.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.PostMassOperation
member.summary: Abstract method which will be executed after DoBatch() method.
member.returns: Returns a Response object.
member.remarks: This assumes PreMassOperation() and DoBatch() methods will not throw any exceptions to interrupt the process.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.ValidateSelection
member.summary: Abstract method which will execute validation of a batch set to be processed.
member.returns: Returns a Response object.
member.remarks: If this method fails the red modal box will be displayed on the mass operation handler popup as well as the OK button will be disabled.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.ValidateLayout
member.summary: Abstract method which will execute validation of a layout attached to a mass operation handler.
member.returns: Returns a Response object.
member.remarks: This method will execute only on mass operation handlers which are assembly backed with a layout being attached. If it fails it will display a warning modal box inside the mass operation handler.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.IncrementCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method which will update the current count of the executing batch.
member.param: Integer value indicating the current count of an executing batch.
member.remarks: This can be used to update the progress bar on the popup when mass operation handler is executing.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.ChangeStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Method which will update a status of a mass operation handler execution process.
member.param: String value depicting the current status of a process.

member.name: M:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.IsCancelled
member.summary: Method which returns True if a user clicked Cancel button on currently executing batch.
member.returns: True/False

member.name: E:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.UpdateCount
member.summary: Raises an event to update the current count of executing batch.
member.param: Integer value indicating the current count of an executing batch.

member.name: E:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.UpdateStatus
member.summary: Raises an event to update a status of a mass operation handler execution process.
member.param: String value depicting the current status of a process.

member.name: E:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler.CheckCancelled
member.summary: Raises an event of a Cancel button click action on currently executing batch.
member.param: Boolean value indicating if current batch needs to be cancelled.
member.remarks: It is automatically raised when IsCancelled() method is called.

member.name: T:kCura.MassOperationHandlers.MassOperationHandler
member.summary: Base class for mass operation handlers.
